definition: front sight (firearms)/the zero point indicator marked on a steelyard
to allow/to grant/in accordance with/in the light of

sentences.english: Position the crosshair to select a difference and press fire when you're done.
sentences.chinese: 选择一个十字准星位置差异和按火当你做了。

sentences.english: I can hurl tennis rackets at small moving objects with deadly accuracy.
sentences.chinese: 用网球拍投掷移动的小东西，我准星挺高。

sentences.english: The media has seemingly lost all sense of proportion.
sentences.chinese: 现在的媒体报道似乎都失去了自己的准星儿。

sentences.english: Yes. The new crosshair has a small center dot with the standard 4 "legs."
sentences.chinese: 有，全新的准星有4个竖条，中间是一个小点。

sentences.english: Fixed sights have luminous inserts for low light conditions.
sentences.chinese: 固定的准星有发光嵌件用于低照度条件。

sentences.english: Mechanically he reached for the empty gun, drew a bead, and pulled the trigger.
sentences.chinese: 他机械地抓起了那支空枪，瞄好准星，抠下板机。

sentences.english: The crosshair will expand when the player is moving.
sentences.chinese: 当玩家移动的时候，准星会扩张。

sentences.english: I rather doubt you could trust its aim,” he said.
sentences.chinese: 我很怀疑有人敢相信它的准星。

sentences.english: When you've aligned the notch on the gun with the target, fire!
sentences.chinese: 当你把枪的准星和目标对齐，那就开火。

sentences.english: The crosshair is reduced to a dot.
Tao gets up to have no a gun sight.

definition: not up to scratch/subpar/off/gone awry/(of an instrument) to be out of kilter/(of a forecast) to be off the mark
(military) line of troops encircling an enemy position/(telephony) outside line/(basketball) outside the three-point line
the feel (of sth touched with the hand)/(textiles) handle
gun/firearm/rifle/spear/thing with shape or function similar to a gun/CL:支[zhi1],把[ba3],桿|杆[gan3],條|条[tiao2],枝[zhi1]/to substitute for another person in a test/to knock/classifier for rifle shots
